name: Sales Follow-up
description: Daily follow-up sweep: drafts personalized follow-ups, flags stalled leads, and produces send-ready messages.

install_inputs.label: Where should the follow-up report be posted?

agents.purpose: High-quality follow-up copywriting that matches brand voice.
agents.notes: Uses existing agent id; v1 can reference rather than clone agents.

agents.purpose: Orchestrates the daily sweep + posts results.
agents.notes: Fallback agent if other agent ids are missing.

payload.message:
You are running the Sales Follow-up Starter Pack.

Sales context: {{sales_context}}

Task:
1) Ask for (or locate) a short list of leads that need follow-up today (names + last touch + goal).
2) For each lead, draft a concise follow-up message. Provide: subject line + body.
3) Provide a one-paragraph internal note: what changed since last touch, and the next best ask.

Output format:
- Top: 3 highest-priority follow-ups
- Then: the remaining follow-ups
- End: questions you need answered to improve tomorrow's sweep.

If no lead list exists yet, ask the user to paste one (5–20 lines) and stop.

Evening pipeline nudge.

Sales context: {{sales_context}}

1) Ask: Did we send the follow-ups drafted today?
2) If not, produce a shorter, more direct version for each unsent follow-up.
3) Suggest one experiment to improve reply rates (A/B subject line, shorter CTA, etc.).

Keep the whole message under 250 words unless the user explicitly asks for full drafts.

example_prompts: Install the Sales Follow-up pack and post reports to #sales.
Run the Sales Follow-up Sweep now. Here are 12 leads with last-touch notes: ...
Rewrite these follow-ups to be 30% shorter and more direct.
Change the morning sweep to run at 8:00am instead of 9:00am.
